short_bio: Nabil Ahmed is a passionate Bangladeshi chef who specializes in traditional and fusion Bangladeshi cuisine. He has worked as a chef in several high-end restaurants and hotels in Bangladesh and has also participated in various cooking competitions.

recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add chicken and fry for 5-7 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add tomatoes and shatkora and fry for 2-3 minutes. Add water and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked. Add garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.recipe_name: Chingri Macher Malaikari (Prawn Curry with Coconut Milk)
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add prawns and fry for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add coconut milk and green chilies. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until the prawns are cooked. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Wash the rice and lentils together in cold water and let them soak for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pot and add the whole spices. Fry for a minute. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chilli powder. Mix well. Add the soaked rice and lentils and fry for 3-4 minutes. Add water and salt to taste. Bring it to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice and lentils are cooked and the water is absorbed. Serve hot with your choice of sides.

short_bio: Mohammad Ali is a renowned Bangladeshi chef with over 15 years of experience in traditional Bangladeshi cuisine. He has worked in various top-rated restaurants in Bangladesh and has won several awards for his exceptional cooking skills.

recipes.recipe_name: Chitol Macher Muitha (Fish Dumplings in Spicy Broth)
recipes.cooking_method: Grind the fish and mix with salt, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Make small dumplings out of the mixture. Heat oil in a pan and fry the dumplings until they turn golden brown. Set them aside. In the same pan, fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add tomatoes and fry for 2-3 minutes. Add water and bring to a boil. Add the fried dumplings and cook for 5-7 minutes. Add garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot.

recipes.recipe_name: Shorshe Ilish (Hilsa Fish in Mustard Sauce)
recipes.cooking_method: Grind the mustard seeds with a little bit of water to form a paste. Marinate the fish pieces with salt and turmeric powder. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. Set them aside. In the same pan, add onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the mustard paste and fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add 1 cup of water and green chilies. Bring to a boil. Add the fried fish pieces and simmer for 5-7 minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.recipe_name: Lau Shaker Chorchori (Bottle Gourd Curry with Mixed Vegetables)
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, potato), chopped
1 tsp panch phoron (Bengali five spice blend)
recipes.cooking_method: Heat mustard oil in a pan. Add panch phoron and fry until fragrant. Add onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Mix well. Add bottle gourd and mixed vegetables and fry for 5-7 minutes. Add tomatoes and salt. Mix well. Add 1/2 cup water and cover and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the vegetables are cooked. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice.

short_bio: Ayesha Rahman is a renowned Bangladeshi chef who has mastered traditional Bangladeshi cuisine. She has over 20 years of experience working in the culinary industry and has been recognized for her outstanding contributions to the field.

recipes.cooking_method: Heat mustard oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add fish and fry for 5-7 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add tomatoes and enough water to cover the fish. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the fish is cooked. Add garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Heat oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add beef and fry for 10-12 minutes or until browned. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until the tomatoes are softened. Add enough water to cover the beef and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 30-35 minutes or until the beef is tender. Add garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: 1 kg mutton, cut into small pieces
recipes.cooking_method: Heat mustard oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add fish and fry for 5-7 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add tomatoes and enough water to cover the fish. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the fish is cooked. Add garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice.

short_bio: Farhan Ahmed is a young and talented chef from Dhaka, Bangladesh. He specializes in creating fusion dishes that combine traditional Bangladeshi flavors with modern cooking techniques. With his unique culinary style, he has quickly gained a following and become a rising star in the industry.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Mix together olive oil, chili powder, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl. Rub the mixture over chicken breasts. Bake in preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until fully cooked. In a separate bowl, combine chopped mango, red onion, cilantro, lime juice, honey, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Serve chicken topped with mango salsa.

ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
recipes.cooking_method: In a medium bowl, whisk together soy sauce and cornstarch. Add shrimp and toss to coat. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add onion, red and green bell peppers, zucchini, and snow peas. Stir fry for 2-3 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add shrimp, cilantro, ginger, garlic, salt, and black pepper. Stir fry for another 2-3 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through. Serve hot over rice or noodles.

Heat oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add beef and fry for 10-12 minutes or until browned. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until the tomatoes are softened. Add enough water to cover the beef and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 30-35 minutes or until the beef is tender. Add garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

short_bio: Zakir Hossain is a popular Bangladeshi chef and restaurateur, known for his expertise in Bangladeshi cuisine. He has over 15 years of experience in the culinary industry and has won several awards for his innovative approach to traditional dishes.

ingredients: 1 kg beef, cut into small pieces
recipes.cooking_method: Wash the rice thoroughly and soak in water for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add beef and fry for 10-12 minutes or until browned. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add the soaked rice and fry for 3-4 minutes. Add enough water to cover the rice and beef mixture. Add cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and then lower the heat. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice and beef are cooked. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipes.recipe_name: Chingri Malaikari (Prawn Curry with Coconut Milk)
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add prawns and fry for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they are softened. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 10-12 minutes or until the prawns

ingredients: 1 kg mutton, cut into small pieces
recipes.cooking_method: Heat mustard oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add fish and fry for 5-7 minutes. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add tomatoes and enough water to cover the fish. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the fish is cooked. Add garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice.

short_bio: Nadia Hussain is a popular Bangladeshi chef who specializes in fusion cuisine. She has over 15 years of experience in the culinary industry and is known for her innovative recipes that blend traditional Bangladeshi flavors with international techniques.

recipes.cooking_method: In a large bowl, mix together the garlic, ginger, chili garlic sauce, soy sauce, sugar, salt, and pepper. Add the shrimp and toss to coat evenly. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes. Heat the vegetable oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook until pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.

ingredients: 500g chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
Fresh lime wedges and cilantro for serving
recipes.cooking_method: Cook the rice noodles according to the package instructions. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic, ginger, and chili paste and cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. Add the chicken and cook for another 5-6 minutes until browned. Add the fish sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar, salt, pepper, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through. Serve hot with the cooked rice noodles, fresh lime wedges, and cilantro.

Wash the rice thoroughly and soak in water for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add beef and fry for 10-12 minutes or until browned. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add the soaked rice and fry for 3-4 minutes. Add enough water to cover the rice and beef mixture. Add cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and then lower the heat. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice and beef are cooked. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.
